alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 9:21AM CST until March 05 at 3:52PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tulsa OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Access roads east of the Combs Bridge near Eagles Bluff will be impassable. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday evening to a crest of 13.8 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
